intro: Pyrrheima minus, commonly known as the lesser pyrrheima, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped with a smooth surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
